advisory_message:
Stop Discontinuation | Wynnewood Rd. & Lancaster Ave. (Westbound)

Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the Route 105 westbound transit stop at Wynnewood Rd. and Lancaster Ave. will be discontinued until further notice

Customers should use the stop on Wynnewood Rd. at Penn Rd. (Wynnewood Station)

Temporary Stop Discontinuation

Until Further Notice

Due to area construction, the Eastbound Transit stop for Routes 92, 105, and 106 on Lancaster Ave. and Valley Rd. will be discontinued until further notice

Customers should use the next eastbound stop, located at Lancaster Ave. and Darby Rd.

Temporary Stop Discontinuation

Until Further Notice

Due to area construction, the Eastbound Transit stop for Routes 92, 105, and 106 on Lancaster Ave. and Valley Rd. will be discontinued until further notice

Customers should use the next eastbound stop, located at Lancaster Ave. and Darby Rd.

Detour | Long Ln. - Bradford to Marshal Rds.

Beginning Wednesday, March 23, 2016 - Until Further Notice | Monday - Friday, 7:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

Effective beginning Wednesday, March 23, Bus Routes 107 and 109 will operate on the following temporary detour:

Westbound (regular route on Long Ln.):
- Right on Bradford Rd.
- Left on Sherbrook Blvd.
- Right on Marshall Rd. and continuing on regular route

Eastbound (regular route on Marshall Rd.):
- Left on Sherbrook Blvd.
- Right on Bradford Rd.
- Left on Long Ln. and continuing on regular route

Routes 107 & 109 Bus Stops During the Detour:

Westbound:
- Bradford Rd. at Springton Rd.
- Sherbrook Blvd. at Wycombe Loop (Route 42)

Eastbound:
- Sherbrook Blvd. opposite of Wycombe Loop (Route 42 stop)
- Bradford Rd. at Springton Rd.
- Bradford Rd. at Long Ln.

Stop Discontinued Temporarily | Granite Run Mall

Until Further Notice

The stops located at the shelters at Granite Run Mall have been temporarily discontinued for Bus Routes 110, 111, 114, and 117.

New temporary stops are located at the Sears Auto Center.

Please continue to check System Status for updates and additional boarding information.

Stop Discontinued Temporarily | Granite Run Mall

Until Further Notice

The stops located at the shelters at Granite Run Mall have been temporarily discontinued for Bus Routes 110, 111, 114, and 117.

New temporary stops are located at the Sears Auto Center.

Please continue to check System Status for updates and additional boarding information.

Stop Discontinued Temporarily | Granite Run Mall

Until Further Notice

The stops located at the shelters at Granite Run Mall have been temporarily discontinued for Bus Routes 110, 111, 114, and 117.

New temporary stops are located at the Sears Auto Center.

Please continue to check System Status for updates and additional boarding information.

Detour & Boarding Location Change | Unstable Building

Until Further Notice

Due to an unstable building adjacent to the Chester Transportation Center entrance passengers will board on Welsh St. (opposite to the Transportation Center entrance.)

Southbound (via Welsh St.)
- Right on Rt. 291
- Right on Edgemont St.
- Right on 4th St.
- Layover on 4th St. at Welsh St.

Northbound (via Welsh St.)
- Left on Welsh St. (from layover)
- Board passengers on Welsh St. opposite Transportation Center entrance
- Left on 7th St.
- Left on Avenue of the States then continuing on regular route

Temporary Stop Discontinuation | 16th & Walnut Sts.

Discontinued Until Monday, May 30, 2016

Due to construction, the Bus stop at 16th & Walnut Sts. is discontinued for Routes 9, 12, 21, and 42

Customers should use the next stop at 17th & Walnut Sts. for service

Please continue to check System Status for updates or additional information

Stop Discontinued | King of Prussia Plaza Parking Lot Bus Shelter (Outer Parking Lot)

Effective Monday, March 28, 2016

Beginning Monday, March 28, Bus Routes 92, 99, 123, 124, 125, and 139 will no longer make stops at the bus shelter located in the outer parking lot at the King of Prussia Plaza. Customers should use the King of Prussia Transit Center located in front of the lower level of the JCPenney department store.

The bus routes noted above will make all other regularly scheduled stops.

Customers should refer to the Bus Schedules page for individual route maps or use Google Transit for additional service options.

Until Further Notice

Right on Fox Street

Left on Queen Lane

Continue on Regular Route

As a result of the detour, some stops have been temporarily discontinued. Please refer to posted signs for new bus stop locations

Special Weekend Schedule | Lansdale/Doylestown Line

April 23-24, April 30 - May 1, and May 7-8, 2016

Due to Secane Station construction, all trains will operate on a special Saturday & Sunday schedule during the dates noted above.

Service information is available on the Lansdale/Doylestown Alerts page.

Special Weekend Schedule

April 23-24, April 30 - May 1, and May 7-8, 2016

Due to Secane Station construction, all trains will operate on a special Saturday & Sunday schedule during the dates noted above.

NEW WEEKEND: Please note, all trains will operate on this special weekend schedule May 7-8.

Customers should check the timetables below as trains will operate at different times than regularly scheduled.

Schedules:

Click on the images below to enlarge or download the special schedule as a PDF.

Inbound (towards Center City) Service:

ALL trains will depart 16 minutes EARLIER than regularly scheduled

Outbound (towards Doylestown) Service:

ALL trains will depart 5 minutes LATER than regularly scheduled

As part of this project, a special weekend schedule will be in effect on the Media/Elwyn Line.

Lansdale Parking Garage Construction Project

Construction Update | November 2015

Alternate Parking (Phase I)

Additional parking will be provided at the following SEPTA stations:

9th Street: 203 additional spaces (141 West 9th Street, Lansdale, PA 1944)

Pennbrook: 328 additional spaces available by September 21, 2015 (114 Church Rd., Lansdale, PA 19446)

North Wales: 74 additional spaces by September 21, 2015 (601 Beaver St., North Wales, PA 19454)

Construction updates, photos, and additional information can be found on the Rebuilding the System website.

Special Weekend Schedule & Temporary Boarding Location Change

April 23-24 & April 30 - May 1, and May 7-8, 2016

Due to the Secane Station construction project, all trains will operate on a special Saturday & Sunday schedule during the dates noted above.

NEW WEEKEND: Please note, all trains will operate on this special weekend schedule May 7-8.

Customers should check the special timetables below as trains will operate at different times than regularly scheduled.

Schedules:

Click on the images below to enlarge or download the special schedule as a PDF.

Inbound (towards Center City) Service:

Trains will depart 5 minutes LATER than regularly scheduled, with the exception of AM Train #306 (departs at the regularly scheduled time)

Outbound (towards Elwyn) Service:

Trains will depart 16 minutes EARLIER than regularly scheduled (with the exception of #9301, 8 minutes EARLIER)

Temporary Opposite Side Boarding:

ALL trains at Secane, Primos, Clifton-Aldan, Gladstone, Lansdowne, Fernwood-Yeadon, Angora, and 49th St. will board from the INBOUND (towards Center City) platform

As part of this project, a special weekend schedule will be in effect on the Lansdale/Doylestown Line.

Secane Station Parking Notice

Until Further Notice

Twenty-nine daily fee parking spaces were removed from this lot due to construction activities to improve Secane Station. Permit parking will not be impacted by this work.

Parking Options:

Clifton-Aldan Station: daily fee spaces

Morton Station: AMVET Parking Lot (See Morton ticket agent for details and sales)

Questions?

Contact SEPTA Parking Operations at 215-580-3400

Visit the Rebuilding for the Future Program website for additional project information

Temporary Weekday Boarding Location Change

Continuing Through June 2016 | 9:05 a.m. - 2:30 p.m.

Due to overhead wire work, all Trains will board from the Outbound (towards Elwyn) platform beginning with Train #9346 (departing Elwyn Station at 8:55 a.m.) at the following stations:

Secane Lansdowne
Primos Fernwood
Clifton Angora
Gladstone 49th Street

Please check System Status regularly or listen for station announcements for any additional boarding information

Weekday Schedule Adjustment

Effective Monday, April 25, 2016

Due to ongoing track work, a new schedule will go into effect beginning at the start of service Monday, April 25. Customers should review the new timetable as some Weekday trains will depart 69th St. Transportation Center and Norristown Transportation Center at different times than previously scheduled.

DOWNLOAD: Monday, April 25 NHSL PDF Schedule

Inbound (towards 69th St. Transportation Center) Changes to Service:

Weekday trains departing Norristown Transportation Center between 8:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. will operate EARLIER than previously scheduled

Outbound (towards Norristown Transportation Center) Changes to Service:

Weekday trains departing 69th St. Transportation Center between 8:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. will operate LATER than previously scheduled

Customers should refer to the online PDF schedule with the April 25, 2016 effective date for complete service information.

Weekday Boarding Location Change | Township Line Rd. and Wynnewood Rd. Stations

Continuing Through Friday, April 22, 2016| 9:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m.

Due to track work, all Weekday trains will board from the INBOUND (towards 69th St. Transportation Center) platform at the following stations beginning at 9:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.:

Township Line Rd.

Penfield

Beechwood-Brookline

Wynnewood Rd.

Please check System Status for updates or changes to service

Temporary Weekday Opposite Side Boarding | Parkview Station

Beginning Monday, April 25, 2016 - Until Further Notice | 9:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m.

Due to track and maintenance work, all Weekday trains will board from the INBOUND (towards 69th St. Transportation Center) platform at Parkview Station beginning Monday, April 25 and continuing until further notice.

Radnor Station Improvement Project

Continuing Through Spring 2016

Beginning in November, Radnor Station will undergo renovations that include repairs to platforms and stairs, the installation of new guardrails and handrails, shelter improvements, updated lighting and signage, and new landscaping

During this project, customers should use the temporary stairs for access to/from station platforms

Alternate Customer Parking:

During construction, customers may choose to park at Villanova Station (Station Dr. & Lancaster Ave.).

Please continue to check System Status for updates on this project and additional service information

advisory_message:
Change in Printed Timetable | Saturday Train #1541 (Service towards Thorndale)

Effective April 10, 2016

Due to a scheduling conflict with Amtrak, Train #1541 (Saturday service towards Thorndale), originally scheduled to depart Jefferson Station at 2:30 p.m., will depart 5 minutes EARLIER at 2:25 p.m.

Customers should refer to the Paoli/Thorndale online PDF schedule for the latest service information

Exton Station Improvement Project April 2016 Update

Phase II of Construction Begins Monday, April 18, 2016

SEPTA and Amtrak are partnering to complete station and ADA improvements at Exton Station. Phase II of this project is scheduled to begin Monday, April 18 and is expected to last approximately 8 months.

Impacts to Customer Parking:

While this work takes place, the station's Upper Inbound (towards Center City) parking lot will be closed. The Lower, Inbound lot will remain open but will be subject to closure as Phase II is completed. Customers should check System Status regularly for updates.

View the PDF map for additional parking information.

During Phase II, customers may use the newly expanded Outbound (towards Thorndale) lot, which offers 67 new spaces. In addition, SEPTA has added 36 parking spaces at Whitford Station (407 Spackmans Ln., West Chester, PA 19380) to accommodate Exton Station customers

View station renderings and learn more about this improvement project on the Rebuilding the System Program website.

Levittown Reconstruction Project

Update, May 2016: Station Building Demolition, New Temporary Ticket Office & Platform Locations

Beginning May 2, 2016

As part of the improvement project to rebuild and modernize Levittown Station, SEPTA forces will demolish the station building and temporarily replace the customer boarding and ticket office locations as follows:

New Temporary Boarding Locations:

Beginning May 2, 2016, customers should board ALL Trenton Line trains from the new temporary platform. Please look for directional signage posted at the station for further boarding information

New Temporary Ticket Office:

During construction, a temporary office will be set up and will be open regularly scheduled hours: 5:30 a.m. - 11:30 a.m., Monday through Friday. The temporary ticket office will remain open for the duration of the reconstruction work.

Learn more about this project on the Rebuilding the System Program website

Saturday & Sunday Shuttle Bus Substitution | West Trenton, Yardley & Woodbourne Stations

April, May, and June 2016

As part of the second phase of construction for the CSX-SEPTA separation project, shuttle bus service will replace ALL Saturday and Sunday trains at West Trenton, Yardley, and Woodbourne stations during the dates noted below.

APRIL: 16-17, 23-24, 30 & May 1
MAY: 14-15 & 21-22, 2016
JUNE: 4-5, 11-12, 18-19, & 25-26, 2016

All trains will operate as regularly scheduled Saturday, May 7 and Sunday, May 8

Customers should check the timetables below as bus and train service will operate at different times than regularly scheduled. Shuttle bus boarding locations are noted in the timetables.

Schedules & Service Information:

Schedules can be viewed below (click the image to enlarge) or downloaded as a PDF. Schedules will also be available at Center City Passenger Services locations.

Inbound (towards Center City) Service:

Buses will depart West Trenton and Yardley stations EARLIER than regularly scheduled train times

Customers should transfer from bus to train at Woodbourne Station. Trains will depart Woodbourne Station 5 minutes EARLIER than regularly scheduled

Trains will arrive at Center City stations at the regularly scheduled time


Outbound (towards West Trenton) Service:

ALL trains will depart Center City stations at the regularly scheduled time

ALL trains will arrive at Woodbourne Station 5 minutes LATER than regularly scheduled. Customers should transfer from train to bus at Woodbourne Station

Shuttle bus service will depart Woodbourne Station LATER than regularly scheduled train times. Shuttle bus service will arrive at West Trenton Station LATER than regularly scheduled train times


Tips & Additional Information:

Schedules and shuttle bus boarding signs are posted at stations

Follow @SEPTA_WTR on Twitter or check System Status for the latest service information

Changes to Parking | Yardley Station

Beginning Monday, April 25, 2016 and Continuing Until Further Notice

Beginning Monday, April 25th, SEPTA will utilize 13 parking spots for staging of construction equipment as part of renovations at Yardley Station. As an alternate, customers should park in the SEPTA parking lot on the other side of the station.

Please contact Parking Operations at 215-580-3400 with any questions.

Temporary Stop Discontinuation | 16th & Walnut Sts.

Discontinued Until Monday, May 30, 2016

Due to construction, the Bus stop at 16th & Walnut Sts. is discontinued for Routes 9, 12, 21, and 42

Customers should use the next stop at 17th & Walnut Sts. for service

Please continue to check System Status for updates or additional information

Stop Discontinuation | 19th & Chestnut Sts. (1900 Block of Chestnut St.)

Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the Transit stop located at 19th & Chestnut Sts. will be temporarily discontinued

Customers should use Google transit for alternate stops and service information

Chestnut Bridge Weight Restrictions

Until Further Notice

Due to weight restrictions on the Chestnut Street Bridge, the SEPTA stops at 30th & Chestnut, Schuylkill Ave (29th St), and 24th Street on Chestnut Street are discontinued until further notice.

Southbound Route 9 buses will turn at 30th Street on to Market Street then 23rd Street before resuming their normal Chestnut Street routing.

SEPTA will continue to monitor all bus routes in this area and will make service and route adjustments as necessary.

Stop Discontinued | King of Prussia Plaza Parking Lot Bus Shelter (Outer Parking Lot)

Effective Monday, March 28, 2016

Beginning Monday, March 28, Bus Routes 92, 99, 123, 124, 125, and 139 will no longer make stops at the bus shelter located in the outer parking lot at the King of Prussia Plaza. Customers should use the King of Prussia Transit Center located in front of the lower level of the JCPenney department store.

The bus routes noted above will make all other regularly scheduled stops.

Customers should refer to the Bus Schedules page for individual route maps or use Google Transit for additional service options.

Temporary Stop Discontinuation

Until Further Notice

Due to area construction, the Eastbound Transit stop for Routes 92, 105, and 106 on Lancaster Ave. and Valley Rd. will be discontinued until further notice

Customers should use the next eastbound stop, located at Lancaster Ave. and Darby Rd.

I-95 Reconstruction Program Service Detours

Until Further Notice

Due to ongoing construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Service will operate around the construction with detour stops on Aramingo Ave. at York & Cumberland Sts.

Richmond St. Closure

Effective Tuesday, February 4, 2014, Richmond St. is now closed due to construction. Shuttle buses will detour as follows:

Service towards Richmond & Westmoreland St.

From Aramingo Ave., shuttle buses will turn onto Thompson Street towards Allegheny Ave.

Service towards 63rd & Girard Ave.

From Allegheny Ave., shuttle buses will turn onto Belgrade St. towards Aramingo Ave.

Click here to view the detour map

Route 43 Bus to Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

Service going towards Parkside Loop will operate around the construction with detour stops on Huntingdon St. at Richmond, Edgemont, & Thompson Sts. and on Aramingo Ave. at Cumberland St., York St., & Delaware & Columbia Aves.

Service on Richmond St. between Cumberland & Beach Sts. and Beach St. to Delaware Ave. will be discontinued during this detour

The construction is expected to last for approximately two years. Routes 15 and 43 will be detoured during this time

Revised Schedule

Effective Sunday, April 17, 2016

Effective Sunday, April 17, 2016, a revised Route 36 schedule will take effect that impacts the Sunday evening, 9:29 p.m. trip departing 80th St. & Eastwick Ave.

Customers should refer to the online PDF Route 36 schedule for the latest service information.

Detour | Richmond St. Construction

Until Further Notice

Location: Richmond St. between Somerset and Cambria Sts.

Due to bridge construction Richmond Street will be closed. Buses will divert through the parking lot underneath I-95 to travel between Cambria and Somerset Sts.

advisory_message:
Service Detours

Until Further Notice

Due to ramp construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Route 15 Detour Map | PDF

Service will operate around the construction with detours stops on Aramingo Ave. at York & Cumberland Sts.

Route 43 Bus To Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

Service going towards Parkside Loop will operate around the construction with detour stops on Huntingdon St. at Richmond, Edgemont, & Thompson Sts. and on Aramingo Ave. at Cumberland St., York St., & Delaware & Columbia Aves.

Service on Richmond St. between Cumberland & Beach Sts. and Beach St. to Delaware Ave. will be discontinued during this detour.

The construction is expected to last for approximately 2 years and Routes 15 and 43 service will be detoured during this time

Due to ramp construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

advisory_message:
Weekend Bus Substitution | Between 40th St. Portal & Yeadon Loop

Beginning Friday, April 29 at 10:00 p.m. - 5:00 a.m., Monday, May 2, 2016

Due to track work, bus service will replace ALL Route 13 Trolleys between 40th St. Portal and Yeadon Loop (Chester & Callahan Aves.) during the dates and times noted above.

Service Towards Center City:

Customers should take the Route 13 Bus to 40th St. Portal and transfer to trolleys for service towards 13th & Market Sts.

Service Towards Yeadon Loop:

Customers should take trolleys for service between 13th ST. and 40th St. Portal and transfer to the Route 13 Bus for service towards Yeadon Loop

advisory_message:
Detour | Walnut Lane Bridge

Beginning Friday, April 1 at 6:00 p.m. and Continuing Through Friday, September 30, 2016

Due to construction, Bus Route 65 will operate on a temporary detour in the area of the Walnut Lane Bridge:

Northbound (via Walnut Ln.):
- Right on Henry Ave.
- Left on Midvale Ave.
- Left on Wissahickon Ave.
- Right on Walnut Ln. and continuing on regular route

Southbound (via Walnut Ln.):
- Left on Wissahickon Ave.
- Right on Midvale Ave.
- Right on Henry Ave.
- Left on Hermit St. (4th traffic light after turning onto Henry Ave. Please note, there is no street sign)
- Left on Ridge Ave. and continuing on regular route

The detour will be in effect the entire service day, seven days a week. Please check System Status regularly for construction updates and any further changes to service

advisory_message:
Stop Discontinued | King of Prussia Plaza Parking Lot Bus Shelter (Outer Parking Lot)

Effective Monday, March 28, 2016

Beginning Monday, March 28, Bus Routes 92, 99, 123, 124, 125, and 139 will no longer make stops at the bus shelter located in the outer parking lot at the King of Prussia Plaza. Customers should use the King of Prussia Transit Center located in front of the lower level of the JCPenney department store.

The bus routes noted above will make all other regularly scheduled stops.

Customers should refer to the Bus Schedules page for individual route maps or use Google Transit for additional service options.

advisory_message:
Stop Temporarily Discontinued | Plaza 352 at H&R Block

Beginning Sunday, April 10 Until Further Notice

Beginning Sunday, April 10, the transit stop located at Plaza 352 at H&R Block will be temporarily discontinued.

Temporary bus stops are noted below:

Northbound: Middletown & Dutton Mill Rds.

Southbound (far side): Middletown & Dutton Mill Rds. at Sleepy's

Please continue to check System Status for updates and additional boarding information.

Stop Discontinued Temporarily | Granite Run Mall

Until Further Notice

The stops located at the shelters at Granite Run Mall have been temporarily discontinued for Bus Routdddds 110, 111, 114, and 117.

New temporary stops are located at the Sears Auto Center.

Please continue to check System Status for updates and additional boarding information.

Stop Discontinued Temporarily | Edgmont Ave. & N. Coebourn Blvd.

Until Further Notice

Due to construction, the stop at Edgmont Ave. and N. Coebourn Blvd. is discontinued until further notice.

The new temporary stop is located across from Plaza 352.

Please continue to check System Status for updates and additional boarding information.

Detour & Boarding Location Change| Unstable Building

Until Further Notice

Due to an unstable building adjacent to the Chester Transportation Center entrance passengers will board on Welsh St. (opposite to the Transportation Center entrance.)

Detour (Northbound & Southbound via Welsh St.)
- Right on Rt. 291
- Right on Edgemont St.
- Right on 4th St. then continuing on regular route
detour_message:
NB Via 6th st

reg rte

advisory_message:
Detour | Long Ln. - Bradford to Marshal Rds.

Beginning Wednesday, March 23, 2016 - Until Further Notice | Monday - Friday, 7:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

Effective beginning Wednesday, March 23, Bus Routes 107 and 109 will operate on the following temporary detour:

Westbound (regular route on Long Ln.):
- Right on Bradford Rd.
- Left on Sherbrook Blvd.
- Right on Marshall Rd. and continuing on regular route

Eastbound (regular route on Marshall Rd.):
- Left on Sherbrook Blvd.
- Right on Bradford Rd.
- Left on Long Ln. and continuing on regular route

Routes 107 & 109 Bus Stops During the Detour:

Westbound:
- Bradford Rd. at Springton Rd.
- Sherbrook Blvd. at Wycombe Loop (Route 42)

Eastbound:
- Sherbrook Blvd. opposite of Wycombe Loop (Route 42 stop)
- Bradford Rd. at Springton Rd.
- Bradford Rd. at Long Ln.

EB Via 6th st
L - Potter st
L - 9th st
reg rte

advisory_message:
Detour & Boarding Location Change| Unstable Building

Until Further Notice

Due to an unstable building adjacent to the Chester Transportation Center entrance passengers will board on Welsh St. (opposite to the Transportation Center entrance.)

Detour (Eastbound and Westbound via Welsh St.)
- Left on 7th St.
- Left on Avenue of the States then continuing on regular route

Detour | I95 Bridge Weight Restriction

Until Further Notice

Due to a weight-restriction being imposed on the bridge over Interstate 95, Route 113 bus service will be detoured as follows:

The detour will be between MacDade Boulevard and Bullens Lane in Woodlyn (Ridley Township) and Morton and Melrose Avenues in Chester City and will impact service along Melrose Avenue, including Widener University

During the detour, Route 113 will operate via Bullens Lane, Chester Pike & Morton Avenue

For travel to Woodlyn Shopping Center, customers should use stops on Bullens Lane south of McDade

For travel to Widener University, customers should use stop on Morton Avenue at Melrose
